articles.title: 2022 FIBA AmeriCup: Team USA eliminated in semifinals after loss to Argentina; to play in bronze medal game
articles.description: The U.S. was attempting to win back-to-back AmeriCup titles for the first time in over 20 years
articles.content: Team USA's dream of going back-to-back as FIBA AmeriCup champions is no more. On Saturday evening, the Americans were eliminated in the semifinals after an 82-73 loss to Argentina. Now, the Americans will face the loser of Brazil vs. Canada in the br... [1626 chars]

articles.title: GRAPHIC-Argentina's depleted FX reserves get timely soybean boost
articles.description: By Jorge OtaolaBUENOS AIRES, Sept 9 (Reuters) - Argentina's central bank is set to end the week with over $1 billion of foreign currency purchases, boosted by a government drive to stimulate soybean exports, the country's main cash crop, to bring in much-needed dollars.Up until Thursday, the bank had bought some $866 million, a sharp turnaround from recent weeks where it has
articles.content:

articles.title: Sea's Shopee shuts operations in Argentina, Chile, Colombia, Mexico: Sources
articles.description:
Firm to "focus resources on core operations" and will use cross-border model in Mexico, Colombia and Chile.
Read more at straitstimes.com.
articles.content:
SINGAPORE - Sea's e-commerce arm told employees on Thursday it was shutting local operations in Chile, Colombia and Mexico, and leaving Argentina entirely, according to three sources with direct knowledge of the matter and an internal e-mail.
The Sin... [3020 chars]

articles.title: Grain prices up this morning | Friday, September 9, 2022
articles.content:
To start the day, corn is up 7¢ and soybeans are up 17¢.
CBOT wheat is up 20¢. KC wheat is up 21¢. Minneapolis wheat is up 17¢.
Live cattle are down 3¢. Feeder cattle are up 38¢. Lean hogs are down 45¢.
Still no export repot out of USDA but there was... [665 chars]

articles.title: With carrot and stick, Argentina government drives soy sale bonanza
articles.description: Argentine farmers are under pressure to sell their soy stocks, with the government rolling out carrot and stick incentives and punishments for stock hoarding in the world's top exporter of soy oil and meal and the No. 3 for raw beans.
articles.content:
By Maximilian Heath

articles.title: Shopee's woes continue as it reportedly shuts ops in Latin America
articles.description: The eCommerce firm is reportedly closing its operations in Chile, Colombia, and Mexico and completely pulling out of Argentina.
articles.content: Shopee is reportedly closing its operations in Chile, Colombia, and Mexico and completely pulling out of Argentina, Reuters said quoting its sources. While Shopee's cross-border operations in Chile, Colombia, and Mexico will still remain, there will ... [2194 chars]

articles.title: Shopee's woes continue as it pulls out of Argentina
articles.description: The eCommerce firm is also reportedly closing local operations in Chile, Colombia, and Mexico, shifting to a cross-border model.
articles.content: Shopee is pulling out of Argentina. MARKETING-INTERACTIVE understands that a cross-border model is not feasible in the country and Shopee only had local seller operations in Argentina. At the same time, Reuters said quoting its sources, that it is cl... [2751 chars]

articles.title: Argentina's Uala pairs with Mexico's ABC Capital for remittance market
articles.description: Argentina's Uala has moved into Mexico's remittance market by pairing up with local bank ABC Capital, the financial technology firm announced on Friday, in a bid to get a slice of a market that captured $32.8 billion in the first seven months of the year according to official data.
articles.content:
Prepaid credit cards of Argentine mobile banking startup Uala are displayed at the company's offices in Buenos Aires, Argentina November 13, 2017. REUTERS/Marcos Brindicci
MEXICO CITY, Sept 9 (Reuters) - Argentina's Uala has moved into Mexico's remit... [1720 chars]

articles.title: Frosts hit Argentina wheat crop though losses limited, grains exchange says
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept 8 (Reuters) - Frosts recorded in the last two weeks in Argentina have caused some damage to the South American country's 2022/23 wheat crop, the Buenos Aires grains exchange said on Thursday.The frost damage adds to the impact caused by drought seen in recent months, which led the key grains exchange to cut its wheat planting forecast from an initial level
articles.content:
BUENOS AIRES, Sept 8 (Reuters) - Frosts recorded in the last two weeks in Argentina have caused some damage to the South American country's 2022/23 wheat crop, the Buenos Aires grains exchange said on Thursday.
The frost damage adds to the impact cau... [1150 chars]
